title: A relation of Maryland together, vvith a map of the countrey, the conditions of plantation, his Majesties charter to the Lord Baltemore, translated into English.
author: Cecil, Thomas, fl. 1630, engraver.
publisher: These bookes are to bee had, at Master William Peasley Esq; his house, on the back-side of Drury-Lane, neere the Cock-pit Playhouse; or in his absence, at Master Iohn Morgans house in high Holbourne, over against the Dolphin, London,
notes: The first chapter is based on Andrew White's "A relation of the successeful beginnings of the Lord Baltemores plantation in Mary-land", which is a translation of part of: Declaratio coloniae.
The words "A map .. English" are bracketed together on the title page.
"The charter of Maryland" (caption title) has separate pagination and register.
The map has caption "Noua terræ-Mariæ tabula" and is signed: T. Cecill sculp.
Reproduction of a photostat of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
